intro: Hieracium tanaodeirum, commonly known as the Tanao dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically features yellow ray florets surrounding a central disk of tubular flowers, and its leaves are usually hairy and lobed. It thrives in dry, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. Hieracium tanaodeirum is often found in disturbed areas and can spread through both seeds and vegetative reproduction.
